Articles.Content:
This is a pretty simple thread, you just talk about what you did today. It can be in games, but not ksp as there is a thread already for that.

I went to our local mall because I have money from Christmas and wanted to see what I could get. I looked around, my indecisiveness led to me not getting anything. After that I looked for DnD books at a book store near us. I didn't do much else, a lot of sitting on youtube. I also have a bit of a sickness.
Played games, moderated a forum, picked up a book from the library.
I solved a Rubik's cube in 8.1 seconds.

I went skiing all day with my friend. He either tore a muscle or broke his wrist, we don’t know yet. Also we were stuck on the lift for 30 minutes in the air because it ran out of power. :| Other than that it was kinda fun because I went down some pretty hard runs.

UPDATE: turns out he fractured the two connection points in his wrist. RIP.

Edited December 30, 2022 by Zozaf Kerman
Update

I got an infection in my mouth where my wisdom teeth were(I got them out around a month ago), it was around double it's normal size. 50% of the swelling was pus and it popped last night. So today I went to the oral surgeon and they popped it the rest of the way and extracted the pus.(SO FUN!)
I've started a new minecraft survival world and want to try to actually beat the ender dragon. Not much else.
Not much. I worked a tiny bit on a WIP countryball comic, checked out some r/aviation posts, and watched some videos about Papers, please. It looks like an interesting game.

I'm not doing much right now, it's only 11am. I think I did a little bit of programming. as for yesterday..

I was watching old KSP videos (like several years before I even heard of the game) yesterday, because I had absolutely nothing better to do. Not even play KSP! I can't play it right now because my only working machine is an underpowered laptop. Not that I'm complaining, I could use a short break from KSP

I suggest you rename it "What did you do in real life today?"

Today I suggested this :D

7 hours ago, Nazalassa said:

I suggest you rename it "What did you do in real life today?"

Today I suggested this

He said it could be in games.

<let's imagine I can embed this player here: https://asciinema.org/a/ou2dz7FOlKmGaTi8NrlELuLgc>

I don't get it, the forums have oembed right? It should embed then.

Edited December 31, 2022 by Nazalassa
How do I embed the link?

On 12/31/2022 at 11:53 AM, Nazalassa said:

<let's imagine I can embed this player here: https://asciinema.org/a/ou2dz7FOlKmGaTi8NrlELuLgc>

I don't get it, the forums have oembed right? It should embed then.

As you can see in my signature, I attempted it with HTML, there was a button for it and it failed to embed so I don't know how to embed, I think it's just certain websites that can be embedded.

Edited January 2, 2023 by Ryaja

18 hours ago, Ryaja said:

As you can see in my signature, I attempted it with HTML, there was a button for it and it failed to embed so I don't know how to embed, I think it's just certain websites that can be embedded.

Asciinema supports oembed, and I think the forums do as well.
To be sure I asked: https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/111158-ask-the-mods-questions-about-the-forums/page/261/#comment-4214658

Yesterday (Sorry, not today) I went to JFK to try some planespotting. I didn't really see any takeoffs, landings, or ground movements in general(too hard to get close and my phone's camera is kind of crappy), but I found a park on the approach path where planes fly REALLY low over your head. I saw a BA 777, a LOT 787, a ton of JetBlue A321s, (And more, I won't list all of them) and more interestingly, 2 PC12s and a TAP A320 neo. It was interesting to see an A320 from a European airline in the US.
in an effort to purge the house of unused holiday foodstuffs, i made rice crispies treats. idk who thought we needed four bags of marshmallows.

On 1/5/2023 at 12:46 AM, Nuke said:

in an effort to purge the house of unused holiday foodstuffs, i made rice crispies treats. idk who thought we needed four bags of marshmallows. 

You after eating said rice crispy treats.
yea them things are good. but not the factory made ones for some reason. i feel like they skimp on the butter.
I chipped my chipped tooth twice to day and can now tactically load the half that chipped off on to the rest by pushing up and sliding to the side.

8 hours ago, Ryaja said:

I chipped my chipped tooth twice to day and can now tactically load the half that chipped off on to the rest by pushing up and sliding to the side.

Sounds painful.

5 hours ago, Rutabaga22 said:

Sounds painful.

Actually it was just a strip crown so it wasn't, I chipped it when I was dreaming that I was eating something, and the second time right after it was fixed

Have been mapmaking all the afternoon.

Next: mountains and similar stuff. Perhaps redo the weird thing on the right of the big island in the center.

Edited March 8 by Nazalassa

12 hours ago, Nazalassa said:

Have been mapmaking all the afternoon.

Next: mountains and similar stuff. Perhaps redo the weird thing on the right of the big island in the center.

What app are you using?

On 1/26/2023 at 7:08 AM, TheSaint said:

What app are you using?

Inkscape, the color palette is from Wikipedia (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:WikiProject_Maps/Conventions/Topographic_maps)

Plus a wacom tablet
 

More mapmaking today: started doing the mountains. (the white spots are lakes)

Edited March 8 by Nazalassa
More mapmaking

I did some more programming....
Over the course of about 5 days or so I think (also getting rid of all the code and starting over completely... multiple times) I somehow pulled this thing together by spit and duct tape:

It's nothing impressive at all. The only programs here are Busybox, and a screenfetch-like program written in C (not by me, someone else.)
It's very limited. Single-user only, can't be bothered with anything else right now. It's more of a skeleton than complete system.

 

Other than all of that I tried to find some lost stuff from the internet and failed (not surprising). One of it was a development discussion mailing list for a particular recently defunct project. I had actually saved archives of it on my computer almost a year back to test another little script I wrote. Shortly after, I deleted the downloaded archives. If only I held onto them a little (5 months) longer or someone invents a time machine so I can tell my slightly younger (early 2022) self to treasure that bunch of text files.. whatever, it's in the past. I regret it, that's all I can really do now. Short time ago while I was looking through files I found a text file, it turned out that was one of the archives (2016-October.txt). At least I have a tiny part of it now, that's nice..

oooh

Will this be the start of a new GNU/Linux distro? :P
